metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9735 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Jetty through 9.4.x is prone to a timing channel inutil/security/Password.java, which makes it easier for remote attackers toobtain access by observing elapsed times before rejection of incorrectpasswords.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9735` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjetty-extra - 6.1.26-5ubuntu0.1
libjetty-extra-java - 6.1.26-5ubuntu0.1
libjetty-java - 6.1.26-5ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: jetty package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.1.26-5ubuntu0.1').
jetty8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
jetty9: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
